channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the Couples Putting Mortgages Before Marriage
item.description: Unmarried home buyers say they are giving priority to a financial foundation over a legal one.

item.title: Howard Lutnick's Other Top Client: Crypto Giant Tether
item.description: Before becoming Donald Trump’s commerce secretary pick, Lutnick deepened Cantor Fitzgerald’s ties with a stablecoin firm being investigated by U.S. au...

item.title: Emerging-Markets Stocks Have Rarely Been So Hated. It's Time to Buy
item.description: The best returns might require investing in troubled countries and looking past the benchmark index to find some gems.

item.title: ‘I already have my ticket.’ These celebrities want to leave the U.S. with Trump as president
item.description: Plenty of celebrities are vowing to move out of the U.S. rather than remain while Trump serves as the 47th president.

item.title: Amazon is beating other retailers on price, but here’s how you can beat Amazon
item.description: Bargain hunters are taking advantage of rebate platforms to bring costs down.

item.title: ‘My house is paid off’: How do I ensure my son-in-law never gets my money — even if my daughter dies before he does?
item.description: “I would like it to go to only my daughter and grandchildren.”

item.title: ‘I can’t deal with managing them’: I juggle 18 credit cards. How do I close them without ruining my credit score?
item.description: “I have very high limits, so charges barely make a blip on my credit-utilization ratio.”

item.title: The Score: Target, Super Micro Computer, Alphabet and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: This neglected issue is a workplace productivity and talent retention threat that demands C-suite attention
item.description: Eldercare benefits aren’t just a nice perk. They’re essential to solving this $33 billion productivity problem.

item.title: Welcome to the World of 24-Hour Stock Trading
item.description: Brokerages seeking to meet the growing global appetite for U.S. stocks are extending their timetables.
